page.description: Performs an action on the web-socket server, such as 'Send a message to the web-sockets server'. The message will be received by all UX and Grid components that are listening for web-socket messages and the 'webSocketOnMessage client-side event in all listening components will fire.

section.description: Used with the Grid and UX components

item.name: Action name
item.description: Specify the web-socket server action to execute.

item.name: Method for creating message text
item.description: You can enter the text for the message now, or you can execute Javascript code at run-time that returns the message text. Choices include *[ui:Text]*, *[ui:Javascript]*.

item.name: Message
item.description: Specify the message. You can either enter a string of text or you can specify a Javascript function by entering: javascript:name_of_your_function

item.name: Message type
item.description: Specify the message type. There are certain 'built-in' message types that Alpha Anywhere supports (such as 'messageboard'). If you just want to send a simple text message (not one of the built-in types) select the 'Simple' option. To define your own built-in message types, you need to add a new .js file to the 'node_services\ws_queue' folder in the Alpha Anywhere executable folder. If you want to call a Javascript function to specify the message type enter: javascript:yourfunctionname

item.name: Javascript for message
item.description: Specify the Javascript to run to get the message text. Your Javascript must include the 'return' command to return the text to use in the message. For example: return messageText;

item.name: Start listening once server is started
item.description: Should the client start listening for messages once the web-socket server has been started?

item.name: Message subscriptions
item.description: Specify if you want to subscribe to all messages, or to a subset of the messages broadcast by the web-socket server. If you leave this blank then you will be subscribed to the list of message types defined in the component. Enter a comma delimited list of message types, or to specify the types using Javascript, enter javascript:yourfunctionname.

item.name: Xbasic function to generate message
item.description: Specify the name of the Xbasic function to call to generate the message. This message will then be broadcast to all of the connected clients.

item.name: Message subscriptions
item.description: Specify if you want to subscribe to all messages, or to a subset of the messages broadcast by the web-socket server. If you leave this blank then you will be subscribed to the list of message types defined in the component. Enter a comma delimited list of message types, or to specify the types using Javascript, enter javascript:yourfunctionname.
